Direzione o partecipazione a comitati ed.content: Editorial Board, ISLE (Interdisciplinary Studies in Literature and Environment), New York: Oxford University Press. (Rivista in fascia A)
Advisory Board, Ecozon@. European Journal of Literature, Culture and the Environment (Rivista in fascia A) http://ecozona.eu/about/displayMembership/10
Editorial Board, Relations: Beyond Anthropocentrism. Milan: LED. (http://www.ledonline.it/Relations/)
Editorial Board, “IRENE – Interdisciplinary Researches on Ethics and the Natural Environment, Milan: LED.
Editorial Board, Green Letters: Studies in Ecocriticism, London: Taylor & Francis (http://asle.org.uk/green-letters)
Advisory Board, “Ecocritical Theory and Practice,” Lanham (MD): Lexington Books/Rowman & Littlefield. (https://rowman.com/Action/SERIES/LEX/ETAP#)
Advisory Board, PAN. Philosophy Activism Nature (http://www.panjournal.net)
Section Editor, Creative Writing and Arts, Ecozon@. European Journal of Literature, Culture and the Environment (Rivista in fascia A)
Series Editor, “Studien zu Literatur, Kultur und Umwelt/Studies in Literature, Culture, and the Environment,” Bern & New York: Peter Lang.

Organizzazione o partecipazione come rel.content: Conference Presentation (Panelist): “Fireflies, Hills and Altarpieces. Pier Paolo Pasolini’s Ethics of Cultural Landscape,” International Conference on “Culture and the State,” University of Alberta, Edmonton (Canada).

Conference Presentation (Panelist): “Sprache, Geschichte und Ende der Landschaft. Eine Auffassung der Werke Pier Paolo Pasolinis.” The First Biennial Conference of EASCLE (European Association for the Study of Literature, Culture and Environment): Literatur, Kultur, Umwelt: ‘Ecocriticism’ – eine Standortbestimmung, Universität Münster (Germany).

Conference Presentation (Panelist): “Watershed Politics and Place-Identity: Toward an Inclusive Approach,” The Second Biennial Conference of EASCLE (European Association for the Study of Literature, Culture and Environment): Water: literary, cultural and environmental Perspectives, Alpen-Adria Universität, Klagenfurt (Austria).
Plenary Lecture: “Ambiente, cultura e stili di vita,” Prima Conferenza Internazionale su Ambiente e Sostenibilità, Università di Modena e Reggio Emilia, Reggio Emilia (Italy), May 10, 2007.

Plenary Lecture: “Ecocriticism and a Non-Anthropocentric Humanism,” Local Natures/Global Responsibilities: Annual Conference of the Association for the Study of the New Literatures in English (ASNEL), Friedrich-Schiller-Universitaet, Jena (Germany), May 17-20, 2007.

Conference Presentation (Panelist): “Difference and Warning: The Transverse Feminine in Anna Maria Ortese’s The Iguana,” Confluence, The Seventh Biennial Conference of ASLE (Association for the Study of Literature and Environment), Wofford College, Spartanburg (USA).

Invited Lecture: “La cultura dell’ecocriticism,” Ecocriticism: Retorica e immaginario della natura nel canone letterario occidentale, Conferenza Internazionale, Università degli Studi di Roma “La Sapienza,” Rome (Italy) June 26-27 2007.
Steering Committee: Cultural Landscapes: III Conference of the European Association for the Study of Literature, Culture and Environment, Universidad de Alcalá de Henares, 16-18.10.2008.

Invited Conference Presentation: “The Inquietude of Otherness. An ecofeminist interpretation of Anna Maria Ortese’s The Iguana,” The Fourth Tamkang International Conference on Ecological Discourse: Crisscrossing Word and World: Ecocriticism, Crisis, and Representation, Tamkang University (Taiwan).

Plenary Lecture: “Naples 2008, Or, The Waste Land: Trash, Citizenship, and the Power of Narrations,” Beyond Thoreau: American and International Responses to Nature, Tsinghua University, Beijing (China), October 8-11, 2008.

Conference Presentation (Panelist): “Redeeming Nature? The Garden as a Moral Allegory,” Cultural Landscapes: The Third Biennial Conference of EASLCE (European Association for the Study of Literature, Culture and Environment), Universidad de Alcalá de Henares (Spain).

Invited Lecture: “Quanto scommettiamo? Scienza, ambiente, letteratura e un’idea di cibernetica,” Che tempo farà. Scienza e ambiente nella crescita e nella formazione dei ragazzi, Rete Bibliotecaria Provinciale di Chieti, col patrocinio del Ministero dell’Istruzione, dell’Università e della Ricerca, Ortona (Italy), November 28-29, 2008.
Scientific Committee: International Conference: New Grounds: Ecocriticism, Globalization and Cultural Memory, Radboud University, Nijmegen (The Netherlands), 13-15.1.2010.

Steering Committee: Environmental Change/Cultural Change, Joint Conference of European Association for the Study of Literature, Culture and Environment and Association for the Study of Literature and Environment-UK and Ireland, University of Bath, Bath (UK), 1-4.9.2010.

Plenary Lecture: “The Human Alien. Italo Calvino’s ‘The Watcher’ and a Reflection on the Future of Ecocriticism.” International Conference on The Future of Ecocriticism: New Horizons. Antalya (Turkey), November 6-8, 2010.

Plenary Lecture: “The New City and the Waste Land: Naples, Trash, and an Ethic of Narration.” International Conference: New Grounds: Ecocriticism, Globalization and Cultural Memory, January 13-15, 2010. Radboud University, Nijmegen (The Netherlands).

Plenary Lecture: “Experiencing the Human: Considerations on a Third-Wave-Ecocriticism.” International Conference on Literature and Environmental Awareness. Ecole Normale Supérieure, Lyon (France), March 19, 2010.

Expert Reviewer. Research Council for Culture and Society (RCCS) at the Academy of Finland, Helsinki. Panel: Literature. The Academy of Finland (http://www.aka.fi/en-GB/A/) is Finland’s most important public agency for research funding. It promotes scientific research and international co-operation and serves as an expert body in science policy questions. RCCS is one of the four research councils of the Academy of Finland, covering a wide area of humanities and social sciences. The applications to be assigned to the review panel are in three categories: three-year Postdoctoral grants (9), five-year Academy research fellowship (4) and Academy research projects (10).

Prof. Evi Zemanek (Germany).
